bodydiv.p: The Board undertakes a public consultation on the work plan every five years by way of a public request for information. The Board normally allows a minimum of 120 days for comment on a work plan (agenda) consultation request for information. The primary objective of the review is to seek formal public input on the strategic direction and balance of the Board’s work plan, including the criteria for assessing projects that may be added to the Board’s work plan. The review could also seek views on financial reporting matters that respondents think should be given priority by the Board, together with any proposals to withdraw from the Board’s work plan any projects that have not proceeded as planned or for which the prospects for progress are limited. The Board’s discussion of potential projects to be added to or withdrawn from the work plan takes place in public Board meetings.
